A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I grew up with the original trilogy.  This movie did go places I wasn't expecting with Luke.  We tend not to look at characters we love and admire as people that are fallible.  Part of me is saddened to see this hero I have admired be so disillusioned.  Overall his journey does make sense.  Luke had is whole life destroyed because of Vader.  He never met his mom. Finds out who his dad was. Has to fight him.  Yes\, he saw him redeemed but I'll bet it took years to mentally process the evil deeds of Vader.  Its no wonder he was so terrified of what Ben could become.  I think he took on too much too soon.   

Did Kylo ever had a chance?  Snoke corrupted and manipulated him from such a young age.  He probably felt betrayed knowing his uncle and mentor for a moment\, thought about killing him.  With the knowledge that Vader is grandfather\, Snoke temptation\, you have a recipe for disaster.

Yes the movie does have some faults.  I wish we had answers about Snoke's orgins... 

But there is no denying that this was storytelling at its finest.  As fans we are protective of the things we love.   We have to realize and understand that there are going to be stories and character arcs we don't agree with.  Ideas and plots we come up with in our heads can sometimes seem absolute.  We still have to remember these characters are prone to mistakes and not the superheros we expect them to be.

Give The Last Jedi a chance...
